results.title: Station in life
results.creator_credit: John Gordon, Frank Torley and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows some of the daily activities on a sheep property in the New Zealand high country. Notes the effect of the climate on the husbandry practices at this station and the changes in land use due to soil erosion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Gordon, Frank Torley and Television New Zealand

results.title: Fossils: clues to the past
results.creator_credit: Willis Briley, Sidney Platt, Thomas Craven and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Discusses what a fossil is, the ways in which fossils may be formed, what a fossil can tell us and how scientists determine their age. Shows a dig in Montana, USA, and the fossils being discovered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willis Briley, Sidney Platt, Thomas Craven and National Geographic Society

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston, Julie Ruth and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia

results.title: Not just your average sausage
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television One (New Zealand)
results.brief_description: Provides a description of the manufacture of salami from its source to the consumer. Highlights the role of the European tradition to the high level of skills required in the processing of salami.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television One (New Zealand)

results.title: Milk
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows how conventional dairy processing has been diversified to include such varied products as case in (used in the pharmaceutical and plastics industry) and minipad butter (used in the travel and hospitality industries) and cheescakes. Provides a good insight into the diversity of manufacturing that takes place in a modern dairy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand

results.title: Fish
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Introduces the labour intensive processing of raw fish into a range of consumer products including quality control and the impact of modern technology upon the industry.

results.title: Beer
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Presents an examination of beer production. Indicates the processing stages, and the resulting outputs of products, by-products and wastes. Chemical processes in fermentation are also considered. The program lends itself to students developing a flow chart of the manufacturing system, with inputs of various values, quantities and types.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand

results.title: My brother Jack
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Part one: Presents an interview with Jack Johnston’s wife and daughter to provide a background to the novel “My brother Jack”. Part Two: Features John Barnes of La Trobe University discussing the main issues raised in the book.

results.title: 1984 [a discussion]
results.brief_description: Considers George Orwell’s classic text “1984”. Provides an exposition of Owell’s basic themes together with a consideration of his intention to warn against tendencies he saw in society and an assessment of their realization compared with Huxley’s grim warning in “Brave New World”
